servinfo.title: “AIR BAG” Warning Lamp Cannot Indicate Flashing Pattern of DTC (If Equipped with “AIR BAG” Monitor Coupler)

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to “AIR BAG” Warning Lamp Flashes .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

ptxt.emph: Step 2: Check for open circuit in air bag diagnosis switch circuit.

testgroup.ptxt: Inspect connection between diagnostic switch terminal on “AIR BAG” monitor coupler and body ground with service wire.
testgroup.question: Are they connected securely with service wire?

action.ptxt: Properly connect diagnostic switch terminal on “AIR BAG” monitor coupler and body ground with service wire.

test1.ptxt: Check for proper connection at “PPL” wire (“G47-14” terminal or “G46-12” terminal of SDM connector and “G34-2” terminal of “AIR BAG” monitor coupler (1)) terminals.
If OK, then measure resistance between “G47-14” terminal [A] or “G46-12” terminal [B] and “G34-2” terminal.

action.ptxt: Check “PPL” wire terminals. If OK, repair high resistance or open in “PPL” wire circuit.
Substitute a known good SDM and recheck.

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components and ensure all components are properly mounted.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
